items.title: Alienware’s 2025 model 34-inch 240Hz QD-OLED curved gaming monitor just hit a new all-time low at $150 off
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Alienware’s 34-inch 240Hz QD-OLED curved gaming monitor (AW3425DW) down to $649.99 shipped. This particular model debuted earlier this year in April carrying an $800 price tag, and it has only seen one major discount since then, with the rest being relatively smaller deals. Today’s deal, which is also matched directly at Dell as part of its ongoing Black Friday sale, shaves $150 off its usual going rate, landing it $30 below its previous all-time low. This monitor is loaded with great features to upgrade your overall gaming experience, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

Fanttik is a brand that has caught my eye over the last several months thanks to its standout take on tools. More often than not it leans into USB-C charging instead of separate batteries that other brands tend to require. This angle grinder can be plugged in the same way as your phone and is ready to tackle all sorts of projects.

items.title: Tom Cruise on his first Oscar: Making films 'is who I am'
items.summary: The Mission: Impossible star received the honorary prize after being nominated four times for an Academy Award.

items.title: Google updates its weather forecasts with a new AI model
items.summary: Google debuted a new and improved AI weather model today that will be incorporated into popular products like Search, Gemini, and Pixel phones.  The company’s AI-enhanced forecasts have proven themselves to be quite accurate so far. AI weather models have also been able to make predictions faster and more efficiently than conventional physics-based models. Until […]

items.title: roborock’s latest and upgraded Qrevo CurvX robot vac & mop with premium features hits a new $850 low (Reg. $1,500)
items.summary:
Through its official Amazon storefront, roborock is giving us the best price yet on its roborock Qrevo CurvX Robot Vacuum and Mop at $849.99 shipped. Occasionally rising back to its $1,500 MSRP, we more often see it discounted down between $1,000 and $1,100, with some occasional falls lower, most recently to $900 back at the end of October. Today’s deal is dropping even further than ever before, giving you a 43% markdown that cuts $650 from the tag for the best new price we have tracked, just in time to pick it up during your Black Friday shopping.

Waterpik Cordless Pulse Rechargeable Portable Water Flosser

Buy for $30 (Reg. $50)

What we love

This modern take on water flossers ditches the cord thansk to a built-in battery that is recharged over USB-C. Working this into your routine can lead to not only a brighter smile, but a healthier one as well.

items.title: UPDF is the $42 AI PDF whisperer you didn’t know you needed (Reg. $150)
items.summary:
Working with PDFs is equally the best and worst of times. What you lose in the difficulty and cost of editing is made up for by universal compatibility and excellent print formatting. However, with UPDF, you can disregard the sunk-cost fallacy and edit your PDFs in peace. Get it now for $41.97 (Reg. $149.99) with code EDIT — its lowest price yet. 

more…

items.title: Nomad’s brand new metal Find My Tracking Card Pro hits Black Friday all-time low, ultra-thin Air model at $22
items.summary:
The official Nomad Black Friday sale is now live, and we aren’t talking about some early sales event here – this is the real thing. We have already detailed the sale overall, but we wanted to shine some light on some of the more popular items the brand sells – it’s Find My wallet Tracking Cards. Now sitting at just shy of 25% in savings, you’re looking at one of the best prices we have ever tracked on my personal favorite wallet tracker, and a must-have piece of EDC, if you ask me. You’ll also find the brand new Nomad Tracking Card Pro with a metal build down at its all-time low price as well.

While there are more affordable chargers out there, Belkin branding, foldable AC prongs, and a vertical design are some features that set this one apart from most of those. So if you don’t like cords protruding from the wall, a vertical design like this can alleviate that.

What we love

With early Black Friday discounts hitting tons of LEGO sets lately, including plenty of Mario Kart sets in particular. Stacking up to 598 pieces, this soon-to-be-retired set lets you expand your racing setups with additions from the Soda Jungle map, complete with a pink Shy Guy, Wiggler, and Piranha Plant figures, and tons of fun accessories/obstacles. All you need is to add your favorite racers to burn brick-built rubber and create exciting races.

items.title: Meta releases a new tool to protect reels creators from having their work stolen
items.summary: On Monday, Meta introduced Facebook content protection, a mobile tool designed to detect when a creator's original reels posted to Facebook are being used without their permission. The new tool extends to Instagram too.

items.title: Ford turns to Amazon to give used cars sales a boost
items.summary: Amazon Autos, which kicked off last year with Hyundai, initially started with new cars. The deal with Ford pushes it into used car territory.

items.title: Judge smacks down Texas AG’s request to immediately block Tylenol ads
items.summary: The Texas lawsuit hinges on the unproven claim that Tylenol causes autism.

items.title: Ramp hits $32B valuation, just 3 months after hitting $22.5B
items.summary: In 2025 alone, Ramp has leapt from being worth $13 billion to $32 billion with new rounds every few months.

items.summary: The startup said that until now, users had to either transfer the money to their Indian accounts or ask someone to handle the bills for them. The other option for them was to use their foreign cards and try and pay bills while facing high charges and payment failures.

items.title: PowerLattice attracts investment from ex-Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger for its power-saving chiplet
items.summary: PowerLattice, a startup founded by veteran electrical engineers from Qualcomm, NUVIA, and Intel in 2023, claims to have developed a groundbreaking approach that reduces the power needs of computer chips by more than 50%.
